com.google.enterprise.connector.spi
Interface Document

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleDocument
public interface Document

Interface that represents a document. A document is a map of String property names to Property objects. Map-like functionality is provided through the findProperty(String) method. In addition, a method provides the caller with the Set of all property names, which it can use to iterate over all properties.

Important: a Property object obtained by calling findProperty(String) is invalidated by the next call to findProperty(String). Typically, the caller will store the current Property in a loop variable, so that it is clear that this rule is observed; see the example code below.

The typical pattern for consuming an object that implements this interface is this (disregarding exception handling): 

 Document doc = ...
 Property prop = null;
 if ((prop = doc.findProperty(specialPropName1)) != null) {
   doSomethingSpecial(specialProp);
 }
 if ((prop = doc.findProperty(specialPropName2)) != null) {
   doSomethingElseSpecial(specialProp);
 }
 ... so on for other special properties as needed ...
 for (Iterator i = doc.getPropertyNames().iterator(); i.hasNext(); ) {
   prop = doc.findProperty((String) i.next());
   // assert(prop != null);
   doSomething(prop);
 }

Method Summary
 Property findProperty(java.lang.String name)
          Finds a property by name.
 java.util.Set getPropertyNames()

Method Detail

findProperty

Property findProperty(java.lang.String name)
                      throws RepositoryException
Finds a property by name. If the current document has a property then that property is returned.

Parameters:
name - The name of the property to find
Returns:
The Property, if found; null otherwise
Throws:
RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs

getPropertyNames

java.util.Set getPropertyNames()
                               throws RepositoryException
Gets the set of names of all Properties in this Document.

Returns:
The names, as a Set
Throws:
RepositoryException - if a repository access error occurs
